Dispute_Type: Ownership and inventorship dispute over patents
Legal_Issue: Whether the Court has jurisdiction to reinstate abandoned patent applications and amend the Patent Office Register
Governing_Law: Section 52, Section 73, and Rule 98 of the Patent Act
Procedural_Stage: Post-abandonment; motion to reinstate and amend
Legal_Rule: Section 52 allows court-ordered changes to the Register; Sections 73 and Rule 98 limit reinstatement to 12 months after abandonment
Procedural_Issue: Failure to act within statutory time limits
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim rejected due to lack of jurisdiction
Key_Evidence_Considered: Timing of Cloutier's actions, statutory deadlines
Applicant_Challenge: Request to reinstate abandoned applications beyond statutory period
Defendant_Response: Commissioner argued Cloutier could have acted earlier
Remedy_Requested: Reinstatement of patents and amendment of Patent Office Register
Authority: Federal Court jurisdiction under Patent Act
Governing_Rule: Rule 98 of the Patent Rules and Section 73 of the Patent Act
